articles.title: Making Music with JavaScript is Easy (Teaching the Robots to Sing)

snippet.text: The ever engaging Giles Bowkett is working on a music and beat generator using Node.js. He's released a free 35 minute introduction showing how to use MIDI to interact with software synthesizers using JavaScript and Node

articles.title: WebKit's JavaScript Engine Gets a New Layer for Extra Speed

snippet.text: A little technical but WebKit's JavaScript engine JavaScriptCore (which Safari uses but Chrome does not) has gotten a third layer, an interpreter called LLInt. It gives a big performance boost by being able to run code more quickly upfront until the JIT is proven hot

articles.title: Mozilla Labs Apps: Submissions Opening Soon

snippet.text: Mozilla is launching an app store focused on HTML5 and JavaScript apps soon and plans to open the app submission process next week

articles.title: Isaac Schlueter and Brendan Eich Discuss JavaScript's Unicode Handling
Valid JavaScript Variable Names

snippet.text: Mathias Bynens looks at what can pass for a valid JavaScript variable name by poking around the ECMAScript specs. He shares a ton of both useful and wacky findings in this post

articles.title: Learn from Haskell: Functional, Reusable JavaScript

snippet.text: Sean Hess has been learning Haskell and thinks there are a few ideas and styles common to Haskell development that make sense to use in JavaScript too, including partial application, function composition, and higher order functions

articles.title: Stop Paying Your jQuery Tax

snippet.text: Sam Saffron of Stack Overflow examines the advice of moving all of your external JavaScript includes to the footer of the page, demonstrates why it's a good idea, and shares some tips for pulling it off

articles.title: Functional JavaScript with CoffeeScript and Node

snippet.text: Nothing mind-blowing but if you're not yet on the CoffeeScript train, this introduction by Andrew Glover is a reasonable walkthrough

articles.title: How CoffeeScript and Jasmine Made Me a Better JavaScript Developer
Ember.js Lunch Talk at Carbon Five on Vimeo

snippet.text: Tom Dale and Yehuda Katz discuss their new JavaScript MVC ember.js over lunch at Carbon Five. There's about 45 minutes of presentation plus 20 minutes of Q and A

articles.title: JavaScript Jabber on Backbone.js with Jeremy Ashkenas

snippet.text: The Jabber panel discuss Backbone.js with its creator, Jeremy Ashkenas. With Yehuda Katz (of Ember.js fame) also on the line, it makes for good listening. Is Backbone MVC or not? Find out straight from the horse's mouth

articles.title: NodeUp 13: 90 Minutes on New ECMAScript and Node Features

snippet.text: OK, it's almost an hour and a half long, but the latest episode of the NodeUp podcast is an interesting group discussion covering new ECMAScript and Node features

articles.title: Giles Bowkett on Making Music with JavaScript (repeat from headlines)
Tinker: A New, Open Source JSFiddle Alternative

snippet.text: Like playing with quick JavaScript, HTML and CSS examples in the browser? Tinker is a new option. This link goes to an example of using Spotify's Search API

articles.title: ResponsiveSlides.js: A Responsive Slideshow jQuery Plugin

snippet.text: A tiny (792 bytes, minified and gzipped) jQuery plugin that creates a responsive slideshow using images inside a single container. It work with wide range of browsers including all IE versions from IE6 and up

articles.title: AtomizeJS: Distributed Software Transactional Memory in JS

snippet.text: AtomizeJS is a library for writing distributed programs that run in the browser without having to write any application specific logic on the server. An interesting idea

articles.title: Escapes.js: JavaScript and Canvas Library for Rendering ANSI Art
jQuery HTML5 Fullscreen Slideshows

snippet.text: A jQuery plugin for creating galleries where the slides are shown full screen using the full screen APIs in Firefox 10+ and Chrome 15

articles.title: jQache: A Simple jQuery Selector Object Cache
LucidJS: Simple Event Emitter Library

snippet.text: Lucid allows you to create your own event system and even pipe in events from any number of DOM elements (a la jQuery's custom event triggers

articles.title: jquery.textntags: Dynamic '@tagging' Support for Text Fields
Let: Forced Timeouts for Node Scripts

snippet.text: let' lets you run a Node.js script for a set amount of time. If it takes too long it will be killed

articles.title: PHP Gets V8 Integration Extension
V8M: Google's V8 JavaScript Engine Ported to MIPS
Experiment in using Web Workers as a Sandbox for User Code
JS Libraries to Process Different File Types

snippet.text: A handy wiki page listing file types and some JavaScript libraries that can process them. This page is open to edit so feel free to add your own
